Description.description: Provides a description of this resource and is used for commonality  in the schema definitions.
Description.longDescription: This object represents the Description property.  All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification.

enumDescriptions.Critical: A critical condition exists that requires immediate attention.
enumDescriptions.Warning: A condition exists that requires attention.

Id.description: Uniquely identifies the resource within the collection of like resources.
Id.longDescription: This property represents an identifier for the resource.  All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification.

Identifier.description: This type describes any additional identifiers for a resource.
Identifier.longDescription: This type shall contain any additional identifiers of a resource.

enumLongDescriptions.Blinking: This value shall represent the Indicator LED is in a blinking state where the LED is being turned on and off in repetition.  If this value is not supported by the service, the service shall reject PATCH or PUT requests containing this value by returning HTTP 400 (Bad Request).
enumLongDescriptions.Lit: This value shall represent the Indicator LED is in a solid on state.  If this value is not supported by the service, the service shall reject PATCH or PUT requests containing this value by returning HTTP 400 (Bad Request).
enumLongDescriptions.Off: This value shall represent the Indicator LED is in a solid off state.  If this value is not supported by the service, the service shall reject PATCH or PUT requests containing this value by returning HTTP 400 (Bad Request).

Item.description: This is the base type for resources and referenceable members.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Oem.longDescription: This object represents the Oem property.  All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification.

Location.description: This type describes the location of a resource.
Location.longDescription: This type shall describe the location of a resource.

Name.description: The name of the resource or array element.
Name.longDescription: This object represents the Name property.  All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification. The value of this string shall be of the format for the reserved word *Name*.

Oem.longDescription: This object represents the Oem properties.  All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

OemObject.description: Base type for an Oem object.
OemObject.longDescription: This object represents the base type for an Oem property.  All values for resources described by this schema shall comply to the requirements as described in the Redfish specification.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

enumDescriptions.PoweringOff: A temporary state between On and Off.
enumDescriptions.PoweringOn: A temporary state between Off and On.

enumDescriptions.ForceOff: Turn the unit off immediately (non-graceful shutdown).
enumDescriptions.ForceRestart: Perform an immediate (non-graceful) shutdown, followed by a restart.
enumDescriptions.GracefulRestart: Perform a graceful shutdown followed by a restart of the system.
enumDescriptions.GracefulShutdown: Perform a graceful shutdown and power off.
enumDescriptions.Nmi: Generate a Diagnostic Interrupt (usually an NMI on x86 systems) to cease normal operations, perform diagnostic actions and typically halt the system.
enumDescriptions.PowerCycle: Perform a power cycle of the unit.
enumDescriptions.PushPowerButton: Simulate the pressing of the physical power button on this unit.

enumDescriptions.Absent: This function or resource is not present or not detected.
enumDescriptions.Deferring: The element will not process any commands but will queue new requests.
enumDescriptions.Disabled: This function or resource has been disabled.
enumDescriptions.Enabled: This function or resource has been enabled.
enumDescriptions.InTest: This function or resource is undergoing testing.
enumDescriptions.Quiesced: The element is enabled but only processes a restricted set of commands.
enumDescriptions.StandbyOffline: This function or resource is enabled, but awaiting an external action to activate it.
enumDescriptions.StandbySpare: This function or resource is part of a redundancy set and is awaiting a failover or other external action to activate it.
enumDescriptions.Starting: This function or resource is starting.
enumDescriptions.UnavailableOffline: This function or resource is present but cannot be used.
enumDescriptions.Updating: The element is updating and may be unavailable or degraded.

Status.description: This type describes the status and health of a resource and its children.
Status.longDescription: This type shall contain any status or health properties of a resource.

^([a-zA-Z_][a-zA-Z0-9_]*)?@(odata|Redfis.description: This property shall specify a valid odata or Redfish property.

Health.description: This represents the health state of this resource in the absence of its dependent resources.
Health.longDescription: This property shall represent the HealthState of the resource without considering its dependent resources. The values shall conform to those defined in the Redfish specification.

HealthRollup.description: This represents the overall health state from the view of this resource.
HealthRollup.longDescription: This property shall represent the HealthState of the resource and its dependent resources.  The values shall conform to those defined in the Redfish specification.

State.description: This indicates the known state of the resource, such as if it is enabled.
State.longDescription: This property shall represent if this component is available or not and why.  Enabled indicates the resource is available.  Disabled indicates the resource has been intentionally made unavailable but it can be enabled.  Offline indicates the resource is unavailable intentionally and requires action to be made available.  InTest indicates that the component is undergoing testing.  Starting indicates that the resource is on its way to becoming available.  Absent indicates the resources is physically unavailable.
